channel.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
channel.description:
According to this article, Valve abandoned the episodic model shortly after Episode 2 and began work on a full sequel, as it's considered a rumor I ask if it's true or not. That's for you to decide.
[url]https://www.nowgamer.com/news/6322/half-life-3-new-rumours-hot-up-debunked-by-valve[/url]
EDIT: Doug Lombardi [url='https://lambdageneration.com/posts/half-life-3-accidentally-revealed-in-former-valve-devs-resume/']sent out an email[/url] regarding this as fake, could just be a cover but that's not likely.

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: finger
item.description:
yes, you´re right

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Hardly the same situation. DNF was being deved by a small team under a publisher. Valve is a big ass dev with lots of resources, and does not have a publisher to worry about.

DNF took forever because they kept switching engines to keep up but where too small a team to do this. Valve is not doing that nor is it a small team.

The publisher eventually shut it down because they didn’t think it was going anywhere. There is no publisher to think HL isn’t going anywhere.

I said that because people are thinking that every day they spend waiting for EP3 means another oMgEpIcFeAtUrE is being added. They’re already over-hyping this game.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
mankyman6:

Let’s not all go “Duke Nukem Forever” on this.

Remember when we all got our hopes up for that…

Hardly the same situation. DNF was being deved by a small team under a publisher. Valve is a big ass dev with lots of resources, and does not have a publisher to worry about.

DNF took forever because they kept switching engines to keep up but where too small a team to do this. Valve is not doing that nor is it a small team.

The publisher eventually shut it down because they didn’t think it was going anywhere. There is no publisher to think HL isn’t going anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
they will release EP3 normally and after 6 hours of gameplay if you wait through the credits it just starts a new game and says “Half Life 3” in the title with a completely different engine and art direction.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
They are keeping the same engine. They say at least ten times a year that they aren’t switching engines any time soon.

I do agree that Source could use a facelift, but if was just graphically on par with Portal 2 I’d be perfectly happy. I’m much more worried about the loading times.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: Kerberos
item.description:
EA creating episode 4? that is rich … if anyone believes that post from that point they must be retarded … but as I’m looking at the “facts” that guy has good old words come to my mind and those are … “a hundred times repeated lie, becomes truth” :facepalm:

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: P0lop1e
item.description:
I would say this depends if they keep the same engine or not.
Source is getting old, although it is ahead of so many out there.
they might consider remaking one first.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: Medkit
item.description:
On a side not guys, the dude who made the original post on that forum… well, he was removed and permanently banned.

If this would be just a baseless rumor, Valve wouldn’t be this harsh. Personally, I think that making an Episode 3, even with an upgraded Source engine, is a little dangerous by 2011. Sure, fans like us would buy it, but I think it’s time to move to an entirely new engine - if they want good sales.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I still believe that they will call it Episode 3. Calling it Half Life 3 wouldn’t make any sense, especially if it’s continuing from Episode 2.

First they make Episode 3, then they dump the episodic shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Nah, its just a name is pretty irrelevant. People don’t seem to get this.

Oh that wasn’t aimed at you. It’s all that endless speculation about the next HL installment that I was getting at.

Read full topic

item.title: Episode 3 Cancelled, Half-Life 3 Confirmed
item.dc:creator: P0lop1e
item.description:
i don’t want to sound bad in anyway when i say this, but…
Wasn’t this already known a long while back?
I saw articles dating form quite a while back, saying that Valve had already dropped the episodic model due to technical reasons.
I suppose the confirmation of no “Episode 3” wasn’t as concrete as this, but it was announced a while back.

But this means they are bound to change engines first, then release the 3rd.

Read full topic
